results.title: Dear Mom and Dad: Are Your Finances Ready for Retirement?
results.abstract: The need to discuss your parents’ futures with them, especially before a potential crisis or inciting event, is true for everyone.

results.title: 3 Ways to Retrain Your Mind to Get Out of Credit Card Debt
results.abstract: Digging yourself out is as much about changing your thinking as it is about redirecting your money.

results.title: The Best Way to Use a Credit Card? Treat It Like Cash.
results.abstract: Credit cards can build your credit and earn you rewards, but they can also put you in debt. These tricks can keep you accountable for your spending.

results.title: The Young Person’s Guide to Investing
results.abstract: Narrowing down all the options and figuring out where to turn can be paralyzing. We’ve got you covered.

results.title: 3 Simple Things You Can Do Today to Improve Your Finances
results.abstract: It’s easier than you think.

results.title: A Ballerina’s Nightmare: ‘Am I More Than Just a Dancer?’
results.abstract: Tiler Peck, the New York City Ballet star, suffered a debilitating neck injury. We follow her arduous path back to the stage in advance of “Swan Lake.”

results.title: A Beloved Neighbor Leaves the Building
results.abstract: An Illinois farm boy who came to New York to be a singer left an indelible mark on the Upper West Side co-op where he lived for more than six decades.

multimedia.caption: Charles Dunn, a farm boy from Illinois who came to New York after World War II and pursued a career in singing, died on Feb. 1 at 99.

results.title: ‘The L Word’ Was a Trailblazer. Can a Reboot Keep Up With the Culture?
results.abstract: For some queer women, the original was a first glimpse of lesbianism onscreen. But the new version has a debt to repay, and it knows it.
des_facet: The L Word: Generation Q (TV Program)

results.title: From Dubai to Mars, With Stops in Colorado and Japan
results.abstract: The United Arab Emirates used a novel approach to build the Hope spacecraft, which launches for the red planet this summer.

multimedia.caption: The Hope robotic probe in Colorado. The ruler of Dubai wanted to offer inspiration for youth in the wider Arab world. “That’s why he called the spacecraft Hope,” said Omran Sharaf, the mission’s project manager.

results.title: The Further Adventures of Betelgeuse, the Fainting Star
results.abstract: The red supergiant is no closer to exploding, it seems. It also no longer appears round.

results.title: An Alzheimer’s Treatment Fails: ‘We Don’t Have Anything Now’
results.abstract: With high hopes, drugs to fight brain plaques were tested in people genetically destined to develop dementia. The drugs failed.

multimedia.caption: Two experimental drugs failed to prevent or slow mental decline in a study of people genetically predisposed to develop Alzheimer's disease at a young age.

results.title: Never Mind the Internet. Here’s What’s Killing Malls.
results.abstract: Yes, the internet has changed the way we shop. But taken together, other factors have caused greater harm to traditional retail stores, an economist says.

results.title: Love Letters From World War II Reveal Promises Made and Broken
